history.text: Hello, How are you today?
I'm good, how are you?
I'm doing great. What did you think of Home Alone
I really like the casting
Great choice in actors
What about you?
I think it was a very underrated movie. I think the critic scores given were very low.
I personally would of gave the film a 8/10.
It seems the critics had a lot of negative things to say
I agree
Yeah, a bit too much negativity and what's worse I don't understand the logic behind the complaints
I would rate the movie around a seven as well
How did you like the overall story of the film?
I feel like a child being left behind on a vacation seems unrealistic
However the film was really funny once you get past that
What did you think?
I can agree with that. Forgetting your kid does seem a bit far fetched...well atleast for that length of time.
I thought it was decent overall, a lot of learning lessons come to light at the end of the film
It was a pretty wholesome film
It's a feel good movie altogether, I would agee
What did you think of the cast? Any standout performances?
I think Kate did a great job portraying a desperate mom trying to reunite with her son.
Joe Pesci was also great, an iconic performance I would say
What was your favorite part of the movie?
Yeah, she played the mom role fairly well, it was believable and immersive. Joe was actually over performing in my opinion and Daniel Stem was just hilarious.
I'd say my favorite part of the movie was then end personally.
I like that the film focused on everything the character's learned throughout the film to be better people moving forward.
So it seems you valued the lessons learned over the actual proceeding events of the film
What about the ending did you like best?
Yeah I think the values was important, don't get me wrong the event throughout the film was hilarious.
In terms of the ending, I'd say parent's learning not to neglect their kids, the kids not bullying eachother, etc.
I can't believe how low the ratings were, the movie has everything you want: hilarious scenes, family bonding, and overall great screenwriting
Yeah, I don't understand what exactly was so bad about the film.
I wonder if they were expecting realistic scenarios or what.
I agree, all important life lessons. I am sure everyone checks for their children before leaving to the airport post-Home Alone
lol I would hope so
It seems the critics were especially harsh towards the director
Yes, but it hasn't stopped him from making more installments of the movie which is good.
Thanks for chatting with me. It was fun!
Have a great rest of your day!\
